meanings.definition: A small temporary structure used for selling goods or providing services
meanings.sent1: During the fair, vendors set up booths to sell their handmade crafts.
meanings.sent2: At the market, you can find booths selling fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The booth selling magic tricks had a long line of curious children waiting.
meanings.sent4: Her booth at the flea market was a treasure trove of vintage items.
meanings.sent5: The colorful booth with balloons caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A small enclosed space used for privacy or security
meanings.sent1: The phone booth provided a quiet space for the man to make his call.
meanings.sent2: In the library, students can reserve study booths for focused work.
meanings.sent3: The photo booth at the party captured funny moments with props.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a booth of secrets, locked away from prying eyes.
meanings.sent5: The voting booth symbolized the power of democracy in action.
